description: Demolition of vacant single-storey building at 46 Inverness Street; new two-storey rear extension and minor internal alterations to adjacent lower ground floor unit of 24 Gloucester Crescent to create larger residential dwelling.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: (2431_)E00_P1; E01_P1; E02_P1; E03_P1; E04_P1; E05_P1; E10_P1; P01_P1; P02_P1; P03_P1; P04_P1; P05_P1; P10_P1; P11_P1; P13_P1; Burd Haward Architects Design and Access Statement dated March 2025; Iceni Projects Heritage Statement dated February 2025; Sunlight and Daylight report by Point 2 Surveyors Limited dated February 2025 (version V1) and Price and Myers Structural report dated 27th January 2025.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
Condition : 3 - All new external work shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies D1 and D2 of the London Borough of Camden Local Plan 2017.
Condition : 4 - Before the relevant part of the work is begun, detailed drawings, or samples of materials as appropriate, in respect of the following, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority:
a) Details including sections at 1:10 of all windows (including jambs, head and sill), external doors and gates;
b) Manufacturer's specification details of all facing materials (to be submitted to the Local Planning Authority) and samples of those materials (to be provided on site);
c) Roof terrace railing details.
The relevant part of the works shall be carried out in accordance with the details thus approved and all approved samples shall be retained on site during the course of the works.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policy D1 and D2 of the London Borough of Camden Local Plan 2017.
Condition : 5 - Prior to commencement of development, full details in respect of the living roof in the area indicated on the approved roof plan shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The details shall include 
i.             a detailed scheme of maintenance
ii.            sections at a scale of 1:20 with manufacturers details demonstrating the construction and materials used and showing a variation of substrate depth with peaks and troughs
iii.          full details of planting species and density
The living roofs shall be fully provided in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation and thereafter retained and maintained in accordance with the approved scheme.

Reason: In order to ensure the development undertakes reasonable measures to take account of biodiversity and the water environment in accordance with policies G1, CC1, CC2, CC3, D1, D2 and A3 of the London Borough of Camden Local Plan 2017.
Condition : 6 - Prior to occupation full details of flood protection measures including a permeable paving, green roof and threshold drains shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Systems shall thereafter be permanently retained and maintained in accordance with the approved details. 

Reason: To protect the occupants in the event of a flood in accordance with policy CC3 of the London Borough of Camden Local Plan
Condition : 7 - Prior to commencement of above ground works, details, drawings and data sheets showing the location, Seasonal Performance Factor of at least 2.5 (or COP of 4 or more or SCOP of 3.4 or more) of the Air Source Heat Pump, shall have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing. The equipment shall be installed in full accordance with the details approved by the Local Planning Authority and permanently retained and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the development provides adequate on-site renewable energy facilities in accordance with the requirements of policy CC1 of the London Borough of Camden Local plan Policies
Condition : 8 - Prior to first use of the air source heat pump hereby approved, the active cooling function shall be disabled on the factory setting and the air source heat pump shall be used for the purposes of heating only.

Reason: To ensure the proposal is energy efficient and sustainable in accordance with policy CC2 of the London Borough of Camden Local Plan 2017.
Condition : 9 - Prior to the end of the next available planting season after the completion of the development, replacement tree planting shall be carried out in accordance with details of replanting species, position, date and size, where applicable, that have first been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. The tree planting shall be undertaken in accordance with BS8545:2014 "Trees: From nursery to independence in the landscape".  Any tree, either existing or replacement, that dies or becomes seriously diseased within five years after completion shall be replaced on a like-for-like basis.
 
Reason: To ensure that the development achieves a high quality of landscaping which contributes to the visual amenity and character of the area, in accordance with the requirements of policies A2 and A3 of the London Borough of Camden Local Plan 2017.
